Editorial changes have been made throughout this IRM. Website addresses, project codes, legal references, and IRM references were reviewed and updated as necessary.
The July 20, 2018 published IRM 4.25.8 is superseded.
This section contains instructions and guidelines for Small Business/Self Employed (SBSE) Estate and Gift Specialty Programs employees.
Table of Contents
Returns and SFR Procedures

) General Overview - This IRM provides general information about basic and gift tax examiner responsibilities, estate and gift tax IRM sections, and and forms used in the examination of estate, gift and generation skipping tax returns and claims. (

) Purpose - This IRM explains Estate and Gift examiner responsibilities so managers, senior-level officials and estate, gift and generation skipping tax return examiners will be better equipped to prepare and submit accurate reports. (
) Audience - This IRM is for Estate and Gift Specialty Tax managers, and personnel at the campus who process estate, gift and generation transfer tax returns, refunds and claims. (

) Policy Owner - Director, Examination - Specialty Policy is responsible for administration, procedures and updates related to the technical guidance information processing steps and methods speciﬁc to Estate and Gift Tax examiner responsibilities, IRM subsections, and forms created for the tion of returns and claims. (
) Program Owner - Director, Examination - Specialty Examination owns and Gift Tax Examination. (

) Primary Stakeholders - Advisory Collections, Appeals, Counsel, Estate Gift Tax Workload Selection and Delivery, Specialty Examination, and Examination Quality & Technical Support are the primary stakeholders for IRM. (
) IRM text pertains to Estate and Gift Tax procedures for delinquent returns, stitute for returns and project cases. This IRM provides direction which is Estate and Gift Tax speciﬁc. (

) Estate and gift tax examiners and managers assigned to examine and the examination of estate and gift tax returns and issues are responsible for complying with servicewide policies and authorities set forth in IRM
, Servicewide Policies and Authorities, Policy Statements for the Examining Process. (
) Examination of estate and gift tax returns should be conducted in a manner that will promote public conﬁdence as stated in the Mission of the Service. IRM
, Policy Statement
) Policy Statement
established a general guideline that examination and processing of returns should be completed within
months of the ﬁling See IRM
, Policy Statement

) Estate and gift examiners and managers assigned to examine and oversee examination of international estate and gift tax returns and issues are sible for complying with all applicable servicewide examination delegation orders and SB/SE delegation orders. A table summarizing estate and gift egation orders is available at IRM
, Estate and Gift Tax, Miscellaneous Procedures, Signature Authority. (
) Section
of RRA
, Public Law
requires the Service to an explanation of the examination and collection process, as well as (
) Internal Revenue Manual with a # Use Only
Delinquent Returns and SFR Procedures
Section 3504 of RRA 98, Public Law 105-206 requires the Service to include an explanation of the examination and collection process, as well as informa-
tion about assistance from the Taxpayer Advocate with any ﬁrst report/notice proposed deﬁciency. Pub
, The Examination Process, must be used for this purpose. (
) Statement of Procedural Rules
requires that examiners must any correspondence (or copy), discussions, reports and/or other material to taxpayer at the same time it is sent to the representative. (
) The Form
return instructions and CFR
, CFR
, and CFR
list required ﬁling documents. (

) The National Quality Review System (NQRS) is a web-based review used by Estate and Gift Tax Policy, Estate and Gift Tax Examination ment and Estate and Gift Tax Quality Measures and Analysis (QMA) to generate and review reports analyzing national quality performance based upon standardized quality attributes set forth in Document

, Estate Gift Tax Examination Embedded Quality Job Aid. NQRS report data is compiled by QMA on a quarterly basis, but ad hoc reports may be obtained monthly. The use of NQRS is explained in additional detail in IRM
, Manager Embedded Quality Review and Specialty Exam National Quality Review Programs and IRM
, Guidelines for SB/SE National Quality Review. (

) Operational Reviews and related NQRS reports are conducted by Territory Managers and the Chief of Estate and Gift to measure national adherence quality standards and managerial performance and/or oversight. (

) Customer (i.e. taxpayer) satisfaction reports are generated by SB/SE Operation Support Research on a quarterly basis. These reports provide masked taxpayer narratives that are responsive to a pre-deﬁned set of questions. The quarterly survey reports are to be used to identify areas for amination quality improvement. (
) Frequent Front-line manager reviews are conducted under the Examination Quality Review System (EQRS), with the frequency based on annual personnel requirements. (

) The following table explains terms and acronyms used in this IRM: Term Acronym Business Master File BMF Computer Files Online CFOL Estate and Gift Tax Embedded EQRS or EQ Quality Review System Estate and Gift Tax Exam EPD Process and Documentation Exam Return Control System ERCS Federal Records Center FRC Generation Skipping Transfer Tax GSTT Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
V Any line marked with is for Official Use

cessing, classiﬁcation and examination of Estate and Gift Tax program returns and claims:

(08-06-2015) Examination Procedures for Non-Delinquent “Pickup” Returns

) Follow the procedures set forth in this section when an examiner discovers, during an examination, that a taxpayer failed to ﬁle a federal tax return which is required to be ﬁled, has not yet been ﬁled and the ﬁling date has passed. (
) If Transaction Code (TC)

SFR is present on the open module for the same tax period, consult the Project Case Job Aid for processing, examining, and closing procedures. This section applies to delinquent returns where no tax module or controls have been established for the tax period. (

) If a return or returns are determined to be required, the examiner will ascertain the reasons why the taxpayer failed to ﬁle the required returns and determine whether any indications of fraud exist.
Estate and Gift Tax (

) When information is developed during an examination that indicates the tax- payer’s failure to ﬁle a required return or returns is willful, or if there is any other indication of fraud, the case will be referred pursuant to the direction of a Fraud Technical Advisor (FTA). In such cases the examiner will not solicit delin- quent returns, payment of tax, or any agreement from the taxpayer. If the taxpayer furnishes delinquent returns to the examiner or indicates he/she intends to ﬁle delinquent returns, the examiner will notify Criminal Investigation through proper channels. See IRM
, Fraud Handbook - Failure to File. (

) If it is determined that indications of fraud are not present, the taxpayer will be advised that he/she is required to ﬁle all delinquent returns without regard to the number of years or taxable periods involved. The taxpayer will be asked to deliver the returns promptly to the examiner. The examiner should also solicit payment of the liabilities, if any. (
) The examiner will set a speciﬁc date for receiving the return(s). The date should be reasonable in light of the facts and circumstances in the case. (

) Upon receipt of a delinquent return, ensure the following items are completed: • Verify the correct name, address, and SSN are reﬂected on the tax return with no strikeovers. If errors are found, consult IRM
, Incorrect Name, and IRM
, Address. • Date stamp the original return with the date received using an official date received stamp. Save the envelope showing the post marked date. (
) Verify the presence of the taxpayer’s signature and date the return was signed. (
) Verify all required forms and schedules are present and the computations are correct. (
) Using IDRS command code INOLES, determine whether an entity has been established for the taxpayer on Master File for a BMF account using an SSN with a ″V″ deﬁner (MFT
or
). If not, complete Form

) Delinquent returns must be processed in order to establish an account on master ﬁle. The amounts reported on the delinquent return are input into master ﬁle. The starting point for an examination report are the amounts reported from the delinquent return. Complete the steps outlined in (
) through (
) to process the delinquent return pick up. (
) Make a copy of the delinquent tax return to maintain in the case ﬁle. On the copy, write in red on the top margin, “COPY OF RETURN”. (
) On the original return, write in red on the top margin, “DELINQUENT SECURED BY EXAMINATION”. The original return WILL NOT be returned the group. (
) Attach a completed Form

, Expedite Processing Cycle, to the front of EACH return, paying special attention to the following: • Check the box for “DELINQUENT RETURN”. • If there are multiple tax periods for the same taxpayer, indicate on the ﬁrst Form
, “Block Together-Related Tax Periods-Do Not Separate”. • If penalties are to be assessed, make NO notations in the penalty of the Form

Failure to pay (FTP), failure to deposit (FTD), to ﬁle (FTF), and estimated tax penalty (ETP), are all automatically computer generated and assessed if applicable. • If no penalties are to be assessed, check the appropriate box(es) the BMF column. • Contact information may be the examiner or group secretary. ) In all cases, the examiner should prepare a Report of Examination Changes for Delinquent “Pickup” (Report) using the Estate and Gift Notebook starting with the amounts from Returns delinquent return to reﬂect tax, credits, etc. per return. (
) The examiner will need to wait until the TC
posts before proceeding with an examination or commencing closing procedures found at IRM
, Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Pickup Returns.
) One of the speciﬁc closing procedures below should be followed to ensure (
) proper closing of a delinquent return: Case Closing • No Further Examination. Use these procedures when no further Procedures for nation is required. See IRM

, No Further Examination Delinquent “Pickup” Closing Procedures for Delinquent Pickup Returns. Returns • Agreed with Adjustments and No Change to Tax. Use these when the delinquent return requires a further examination and the tional adjustments are agreed but there is no change to tax. This includes a change to the uniﬁed credit reported on the delinquent See IRM

, Agreed with Adjustments, No Change to Tax Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Pickup Returns. • Agreed with Adjustments and Change to Tax. , Agreed with Adjustments and Change to Tax Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Pickup • Unagreed cases. See IRM
, Unagreed Case Closing dures for Delinquent Pickup Returns. • For amended returns ﬁled to correct delinquent returns refer to IRM
, Amended Delinquent Returns.

) When a taxpayer refuses to ﬁle a required tax return, the Service has the option of preparing the tax return for the taxpayer which is categorized as a Substitute for Return (SFR). This is often accomplished by preparing an Ex- amination Report or completing a tax return for the taxpayer’s signature. If taxpayer signs a Report prepared by an examiner, it is not considered a tax return and SFR procedures are followed. If the taxpayer signs an actual tax return prepared by the examiner, the return is considered a delinquent and delinquent return procedures should be followed. See IRM
, duction to Delinquent Pickup Returns. (

) Substitute for Return (SFR) procedures in this section are valid when the examiner prepares a Report of Examination Changes (Report) for to the taxpayer in lieu of a tax return. When a taxpayer refuses to ﬁle a required tax return, the Service has the option of preparing the tax return for the taxpayer which is categorized as a Substitute for Return (SFR). This is often accomplished by preparing an Ex- amination Report or completing a tax return for the taxpayer’s signature. If the taxpayer signs a Report prepared by an examiner, it is not considered a tax return and SFR procedures are followed. If the taxpayer signs an actual tax return prepared by the examiner, the return is considered a delinquent return and delinquent return procedures should be followed. See IRM
, Intro- duction to Delinquent Pickup Returns.

When a taxpayer refuses to ﬁle a required tax return, the Service has the option of preparing the tax return for the taxpayer which is categorized as a Substitute for Return (SFR). This is often accomplished by preparing an Ex- amination Report or completing a tax return for the taxpayer’s signature. If taxpayer signs a Report prepared by an examiner, it is not considered a tax return and SFR procedures are followed. If the taxpayer signs an actual tax return prepared by the examiner, the return is considered a delinquent return and delinquent return procedures should be followed. See IRM 4.25.8.3, duction to Delinquent Pickup Returns.

Substitute for Return (SFR) procedures in this section are valid when the examiner prepares a Report of Examination Changes (Report) for presentation to the taxpayer in lieu of a tax return. Since the ﬁling of a tax return starts the assessment statute expiration date, do not change the statute date. It remains as “EE”.
Note: If a statute date for a substitute for return is inadvertently changed to a numerical date, it can be reversed by changing the date back to “EE” and adding Aging Reason Code
However, do not use Aging Reason Code
until a report is issued showing that the “EE” has been overlaid with a numerical date. Continue to monitor the record until the statute date is valid with an “EE.”

See IRM

, Case Closing Proce- dures. The taxpayer may appeal the penalty after assessment. After determining that the taxpayer agrees with the tax assessment, but not agree with the penalty determination, the examiner should prepare three copies of the Letter
-day Letter for SFR with Agreed Tax and Unagreed Penalty, letter package to provide notice to the taxpayer that they have post assessment appeal rights. Each of the completed documents in Letter
-S package. items (a) through (d), should be uploaded to IMS prior to closure. The Letter

Court is a court of limited jurisdiction, the court may exercise jurisdiction only to the extent expressly provided by Congress. See IRC 7442. IRC 6213 confers jurisdiction on the Tax Court to redetermine deﬁciencies in income, estate, gift, and certain excise taxes. The provision which confers jurisdiction on the court to review an addition to tax for late ﬁling is IRC 6665. If no part of the determined addition-to-tax or penalty is attributable to a tax deﬁciency, the Tax Court no longer has jurisdiction to decide the merits of the addition-to-tax or penalty. See Forgey v. Commissioner, 115 TC 142 (2000). A statutory of deﬁciency cannot be issued for the addition-to-tax or penalty. The case will be closed as an agreed case, with all penalty assessment information on the Form 3198 and Form 5344. See IRM 4.25.10, Case Closing Proce- dures. The taxpayer may appeal the penalty after assessment.
) After determining that the taxpayer agrees with the tax assessment, but does not agree with the penalty determination, the examiner should prepare three copies of the Letter
-day Letter for SFR with Agreed Tax and Unagreed Penalty, letter package to provide notice to the taxpayer that they have post assessment appeal rights. Each of the completed documents in the Letter
-S package. items (a) through (d), should be uploaded to IMS prior to closure. The Letter
-S package must contain the following documents:

After determining that the taxpayer agrees with the tax assessment, but does not agree with the penalty determination, the examiner should prepare three copies of the Letter 950-S, 30-day Letter for SFR with Agreed Tax and Unagreed Penalty, letter package to provide notice to the taxpayer that they have post assessment appeal rights. Each of the completed documents in Letter 950-S package. items (a) through (d), should be uploaded to IMS prior to closure. The Letter 950-S package must contain the following documents:
a. Letter

-day Letter for SFR with Agreed Tax and Unagreed Penalty b. Examination Report using zero as the starting ﬁgures. The Report fully explain the factual and legal justiﬁcation for the recommended penalty assessment. c. Signed Agreement Forms (Form
) d. Form
, IRC Section
(b) Certiﬁcation, (Form
should be provided to the taxpayer or the taxpayer’s representative). e. Pub
, Penalty Appeals f. Envelope with taxpayer’s address g. Self-addressed envelope After issuing the Letter
-S package to the taxpayer the examiner may the tax assessment case to CCP using standard partially agreed case procedures. See IRM
, Partially Agreed Case Closing Procedures. The examiner should wait to close the electronic IMS penalty case ﬁle until expiration of the unagreed penalty protest period established in the Letter
-S. The examiner should document the protest period deadline, and any extensions in the IMS penalty case Activity Record, Form

a. If the taxpayer does not submit a protest by the response deadline the examiner should synchronize and close the electronic case on IMS. a. If the taxpayer does not submit a protest by the response deadline the examiner should synchronize and close the electronic case on IMS. Untimely protests should be forwarded to the CCP for review and assign- ment to appeals. b. If the Taxpayer submits a protest within the required response timeframe the examiner should close the unagreed penalty case issues to appeals for determination. See IRM

This section will provide guidance on examining, processing and closing various project and research cases related to estate and gift tax.
) In addition to this IRM, information on project cases may also be found on Estate and Gift Notebook, Estate and Gift Shar
oint or by contacting the Estate and Gift Workload Selection and Delivery (WSD) Project Coordinator. (

) Project cases are cases developed by Estate and Gift Workload Selection Delivery (Estate and Gift WSD). Project cases may also be the result of to Project referrals. Case building is started prior to sending the case to the ﬁeld. A module is open on IDRS with a Transaction Code (TC)
SFR posted. The remainder of the record is blank. Only cases with a TC
SFR at the time assignment are considered project cases for purposes of determining which guidance to follow for processing and closing the cases. (

) Once Substitute for Return (SFR) procedures are started, they cannot be changed. The return controlled as an SFR must be processed as such ﬁnal closure whether or not a return is secured. This is the fundamental ence between project cases and regular examinations. (
) The case ﬁle may or may not include an original tax return at the time of as- signment. (

) At the time a project case is assigned, speciﬁc background and procedures may be provided on a Case Insert distributed with the case ﬁle. The Case Insert may also be found in the Notebook Forms Library in the Project and linquent Return Workpapers folder. (

) Some project cases have speciﬁc lead sheets developed for use by the examiner during the project. The lead sheets are available in the Notebook Forms Library in the Project and Delinquent Return Workpapers folder. (

) For most projects, Notebook includes letters and forms related to the speciﬁc project. Use of the approved letters and forms is mandatory. They can be found in the Notebook Forms Library in the Project and Delinquent Return Workpapers folder. (

) Project cases often result in delinquent returns being ﬁled or substitute for returns being prepared. Caution should be taken when processing, and closing these returns as the procedures differ from regular audits. (

) A Project Feedback Form is available in IMS. The purpose of the form is to gather information to improve the quality of project cases sent to the ﬁeld for examination. All responses are conﬁdential and will not be used to evaluate performance. (
) Project, research and tracked issue cases are identiﬁed with both project tracking codes. in Estate (

) A Project Code is a four digit number indicating that a case belongs to a Cases special program which allows monitoring of the program by project code. reports can be generated for a given project to measure the total number of
Delinquent Returns and SFR Procedures
) A Tracking Code is a four digit code used to identify speciﬁc categories of returns. Once a Tracking Code has been added, it should not be removed. See IRM
, Tracking Codes used in Estate and Gift Tax Examina- tions. (
) In most project cases, a WSD case insert or lead sheet providing guidance the project is available in the case ﬁle, Notebook, on the Estate and Gift Procedures Shar
oint, or by contacting the Estate and Gift WSD Project Coordinator. Project Cases (
) The project case insert or lead sheet identiﬁes the project initiative. It also provides the examination scope. (
) This section provides guidance for processing and closing a project case where a TC
SFR was posted at the time of assignment. and Closing (
) A Project Cases Job Aid is available on the Estate and Gift Shar
oint. The Cases Job Aid will guide an examiner through the processing and closing for speciﬁc active project cases. The Job Aid should be consulted in all situa-
A Tracking Code is a four digit code used to identify speciﬁc categories of returns. Once a Tracking Code has been added, it should not be removed. See IRM
, Tracking Codes used in Estate and Gift Tax Examina- tions.

In most project cases, a WSD case insert or lead sheet providing guidance on the project is available in the case ﬁle, Notebook, on the Estate and Gift SharePoint, or by contacting the Estate and Gift WSD Project Coordinator.
